titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 2192, PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE ACT AMENDMENT, AND PROVIDING FOR FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1628, AMERICAN HEALTH CARE ACT OF 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 2192, PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE ACT AMENDMENT, AND PROVIDING FOR FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1628, AMERICAN HEALTH CARE ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 77

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Amending the Public Health Service Act to eliminate the non-application of certain State waiver provisions to Members of Congress and congressional staff
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 2192, to amend the Public Health Service Act to eliminate the non-application of certain State waiver provisions to Members of Congress and congressional staff, by a yea-and-nay vote of 429 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 255.<P/>H. Res. 308, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2192) and providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 1628) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 235 ayes to 192 noes, Roll No. 253, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 193 nays, Roll No. 252.

The House passed H.R. 1628, to provide for reconciliation pursuant to title II of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2017, by a recorded vote of 217 ayes to 213 noes, Roll No. 256. Consideration began on Friday, March 24.<P/>Pursuant to H. Res. 228, the further amendments printed in H. Rept. 115-109 shall be considered as adopted.<P/>H. Res. 308, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2192) and providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 1628) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 235 ayes to 192 noes, Roll No. 253, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 193 nays, Roll No. 252.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Amending the Public Health Service Act to eliminate the non-application of certain State waiver provisions to Members of Congress and congressional staff
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 2192, to amend the Public Health Service Act to eliminate the non-application of certain State waiver provisions to Members of Congress and congressional staff, by a yea-and-nay vote of 429 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 255.<P/>H. Res. 308, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2192) and providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 1628) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 235 ayes to 192 noes, Roll No. 253, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 193 nays, Roll No. 252.

The House passed H.R. 1628, to provide for reconciliation pursuant to title II of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2017, by a recorded vote of 217 ayes to 213 noes, Roll No. 256. Consideration began on Friday, March 24.<P/>Pursuant to H. Res. 228, the further amendments printed in H. Rept. 115-109 shall be considered as adopted.<P/>H. Res. 308, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2192) and providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 1628) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 235 ayes to 192 noes, Roll No. 253, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 193 nays, Roll No. 252.

titleInfo.title: KOREAN INTERDICTION AND MODERNIZATION OF SANCTIONS ACT

extension.searchTitle: KOREAN INTERDICTION AND MODERNIZATION OF SANCTIONS ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 77

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Korean Interdiction and Modernization of Sanctions Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measure. Consideration began Tuesday, May 2nd.<P/>H.R. 1644, amended, to enhance sanctions with respect to transactions relating to North Korea, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 419 yeas to 1 nay, Roll No. 257.
